edu.umass.cs.surveyman.input
Class AbstractParser

java.lang.Object
  edu.umass.cs.surveyman.input.AbstractParser
Direct Known Subclasses:
CSVParser, JSONParser
public abstract class AbstractParser
extends Object

This class implements general parsing utility methods and contains high-level input to survey abstractions.

Constant Field Values

EXCLUSIVE

public static final String EXCLUSIVE
The exclusive column header/JSON key. Used to indicate that answer options are mutually exclusive. The default value is true.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ORDERED

public static final String ORDERED
The ordered column header/JSON key. Used to indicate that answer options' order is semantically meaningful. The default value is false.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

RANDOMIZE

public static final String RANDOMIZE
The randomize column header/JSON key. Used to indicate that the options may be shuffled. The default value is true.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

public static final String BRANCH
The branch column/JSON key.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

FREETEXT

public static final String FREETEXT
The freetext column header/JSON key. The default value is false.

The correlation column header/JSON key.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ANSWER

public static final String ANSWER
The expected response column header/JSON key. If the question is not freetext, this is boolean-valued.

Method Detail

boolType

protected static boolean boolType(String thing,
                                  String col)
                           throws SurveyException
Returns the internal boolean representation of a boolean-valued input to CSV or JSON.

Parameters:
thing - The raw text being parsed.
col - The associated column/key (used for debugging).
Returns:
Internal boolean representation of the input data.
Throws:
SurveyException

parseBool

protected static Boolean parseBool(Boolean bool,
                                   String col,
                                   String entry,
                                   int lineNo,
                                   int colNo)
                            throws SurveyException
Parses the boolean input and ensures that boolean values are consistent across option entries.

Parameters:
bool - The Boolean whose data must be consistent across entries.
col - The column name.
entry - The data in that column.
lineNo - The line number (row) of the data.
colNo - The column position in the input.
Returns:
Boxed Boolean representation of the input boolean data.
Throws:
SurveyException

parseComponent

public static Component parseComponent(String contents,
                                       int row,
                                       int col)
Parses Question and Option column data into the internal representation.

Parameters:
contents - The input data.
row - The line number (row) of the data.
col - The column position of the data.
Returns:
Component internal representation of the data.

addPhantomBlocks

protected static void addPhantomBlocks(Map<String,Block> blockLookUp)
Creates intermediate blocks that may not have been explicitly specified. For example, a CSV following the numbering scheme 1.1, 1.2, 2.1, 2.2, ... will not have explicit top-level blocks. This method will generate blocks 1, 2, ... etc. All parent/child references are validated and/or set here.

Parameters:
blockLookUp - Map of all blocks.

propagateBranchParadigm

protected void propagateBranchParadigm(Block b)
                                throws SurveyException
Traverses the structure of the block and its sub-blocks to ensure that the block/branch type is properly set. See Block.BranchParadigm for a detailed explanation of the block/branch type lattice.

Parameters:
b - A block whose type needs to be set.
Throws:
SurveyException

propagateBranchParadigms

protected void propagateBranchParadigms(Survey survey)
                                 throws SurveyException
Iterates over the top-level blocks of the survey and calls propagateBranchParadigm(edu.umass.cs.surveyman.survey.Block). See Block.BranchParadigm for a detailed explanation of the block/branch type lattice.

Parameters:
survey - A block whose type needs to be set.
Throws:
SurveyException

initializeAllOneBlock

protected void initializeAllOneBlock(Survey survey)
Initializes a block-less survey as a survey of one block.

Parameters:
survey - A flat, fully randomizable survey.

parse

public abstract Survey parse()
                      throws SurveyException
The main entry point.

Returns:
The internal representation of the survey.
Throws:
SurveyException
